text: Python: Can you make this __eq__ easy to understand?
I have another question for you.
I have a python class with a list 'metainfo'.
This list contains variable names that my class might contain.
I wrote a __eq__ method that returns True if the both self and other have the same variables from metainfo and those variables have the same value.

code:
def __eq__(self, other):
    for attr in self.metainfo:
      try:
        ours = getattr(self, attr) 
        try:
          theirs = getattr(other, attr)
          if ours != theirs:
            return False
        except AttributeError:
          return False
      except AttributeError:
        try:
          theirs = getattr(other, attr)
          return False
        except AttributeError:
          pass
    return True

text: Does anyone have any suggestions as to how I can make this code easier on the eye?
Be as ruthless as you please.
